terrapeer.vui.j3dui.control.mappers.intuitive
Class PseudoWrmDragPlugin

java.lang.Object
  terrapeer.vui.j3dui.control.mappers.intuitive.IntuitiveDragMapperPlugin
      terrapeer.vui.j3dui.control.mappers.intuitive.WrmDragPlugin
          terrapeer.vui.j3dui.control.mappers.intuitive.QuasiWrmDragPlugin
              terrapeer.vui.j3dui.control.mappers.intuitive.PseudoWrmDragPlugin
public class PseudoWrmDragPlugin
extends QuasiWrmDragPlugin

A WRM drag plugin that appears to perform WRM but involves no source node picking. Instead it uses target node picking to establish a source space picking plane, similar to that used for quasi-WRM. During the drag the source hit point is computed using the virtual picking plane that passes through the picked target node hit point and is perpendicular to the specified source space Z-axis.

Mouse-over is reported for the target node instead of the source node as in true and quasi WRM.

During a drag this is more efficient than true WRM and does not require that the mouse be over a source node at any time. However, there can be only a single source node and motion is always planar rather than conforming to some arbitrary multi-node source space as is possible with true WRM.

The second half of WRM is performed by a SourceDragMapperPlugin.

See Also:
SourceDragMapperPlugin

Constructor Detail

PseudoWrmDragPlugin

public PseudoWrmDragPlugin(javax.media.j3d.Node sourceSpace,
                           PickEngine targetPicker)
Constructs a PseudoWrmDragPlugin with a source space reference node and a pick engine containing a list of target nodes. The source space node capability bits will be set for live use.

Parameters:
sourceSpace - Source space reference node. If null the world space will be used as the source space.
targetPicker - Target node pick engine. Never null.

PseudoWrmDragPlugin

public PseudoWrmDragPlugin(javax.media.j3d.Node sourceSpace,
                           javax.media.j3d.Node targetSpace)
Constructs a PseudoWrmDragPlugin with a source and a target space reference node. The target space origin will be used as the target hit point for pick plane construction. The source and target node capability bits will be set for live use.

Parameters:
sourceSpace - Source space reference node. If null the world space will be used as the source space.
targetSpace - Target space reference node. If null the world space will be used as the target space.
Method Detail

getTargetSpace

public javax.media.j3d.Node getTargetSpace()
Returns a node defining the current reference target space. Depending on how the target space is defined and the type of plugin this may change each time a drag starts and a new target node is picked.

Returns:
Reference to the target space node. If null the target space is the world space.

pickNode

protected javax.media.j3d.Node pickNode(javax.media.j3d.Canvas3D source,
                                        javax.vecmath.Vector2d pos,
                                        javax.vecmath.Point3d hitPoint)
Projects the input drag position into the scene and returns the hit target node and world hit point on the node. Updates the target node state.

Overrides:
pickNode in class WrmDragPlugin
Parameters:
source - Source display canvas.
pos - Input display position.
hitPoint - Container for the copied hit point in the world space. If null then none.
Returns:
Hit target node. Null if none.
